headline: Norwegian Cruise Line pops, Lam Research slips, Reddit earnings
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, July 31. Shares of Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) are popping on sales growth and upbeat comments about bookings Lam Research (LRCX) is falling on concerns about demand from China. Reddit (RDDT) shares are jumping ahead of its Q2 report, set to be released after the market close. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of cruise company Norwegian Cruise Line (NYSE:NCLH) jumped 9.4% in the afternoon session after the company reported strong second-quarter results and offered an upbeat profit outlook for the year. The cruise operator's balance of advance ticket sales reached a record high of $4.0 billion, a sign of strong future demand. Norwegian posted record total revenue of $2.5 billion for the quarter, a 6% increase from the previous year. The company also reaffirmed its optimistic full-year 2025 guid

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line Sees Record Advance Ticket Sales, Reaffirms Profit Outlook
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NYSE:NCLH) on Thursday reported mixed results for its second quarter. Strong consumer demand continued to drive performance, largely meeting adjusted earnings expectations. The company also reaffirmed its full-year 2025 financial guidance. The cruise operator reported record revenue of $2.52 billion for the quarter, a 6% increase year-over-year (YoY), which missed the average analyst estimate of $2.55 billion. headline: Norwegian Cruise Stock Surges After Earnings. Why Bookings Look Buoyant.
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings   stock was climbing early Thursday after the company reported earnings in line with expectations amid healthy demand for its trips.  The company reported second-quarter adjusted earnings of 51 cents a share on revenue of $2.52 billion.  Analysts were expecting adjusted earnings of 51 cents on revenue of $2.55 billion, according to a FactSet poll.

raw.headline: Norwegian Cruise Stock Surges After Earnings. Why Bookings Look Buoyant.

Analysts were expecting adjusted earnings of 51 cents on revenue of $2.55 billion, according to a FactSet poll.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line shares surge after record second quarter revenue
summary: Investing.com -- Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. reported record second-quarter revenue of $2.52 billion, up 6% YoY, though slightly below analyst expectations of $2.56 billion. The company posted adjusted earnings per share of $0.51, narrowly missing the consensus estimate of $0.52, but demonstrating strong consumer demand across its brands.

raw.headline: Norwegian Cruise Line shares surge after record second quarter revenue

The company posted adjusted earnings per share of $0.51, narrowly missing the consensus estimate of $0.52, but demonstrating strong consumer demand across its brands.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: MIAMI (AP) — Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) on Thursday reported second-quarter earnings of $30 million. On a per-share basis, the Miami-based company said it had profit of 7 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and to extinguish debt, came to 51 cents per share.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line (NYSE:NCLH) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q2 Earnings, But Stock Soars 7.7%
summary: Cruise company Norwegian Cruise Line (NYSE:NCLH) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales rose 6.1% year on year to $2.52 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.51 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.
